comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Thanks for the clarification, I missed that.  I don't see any reason not to make the type public, it probably wasn't done so originally because there was no compelling reason to.  Reflection, per above is a reasonable workaround.

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body:
Seems like `PowerShellProcessInstance` it was excluded from PowerShell Standard (PowerShell/PowerShellStandard#75).

Should it be included in PowerShell Standard?  Honestly I've never figured out the use case for this API.  Was it a workflow thing?

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
/cc @JamesWTruher for PowerShell Standard

Yes, I believe this was exposed for workflows.  Nowadays it is just used for background jobs.

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: WG-Remoting should decide whether NewProcessConnectionInfo should be public to support this scenario. It's not a PSStandard issue as the NewProcessConnectionInfo is internal in 5 (so it can't be in standard)

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: remoting working group: we agree that it should be public, after appropriate code review and testing.

title: make NewProcessConnectionInfo Public
